title: Valentine book sculpture 1905
creator: Stahlecker, Karen, 1954-
description: [Fresno, Calif. : K. Stahlecker]; 1 v. ([10] leaves) : ill. : 66 x 69 mm.; "Between covers of kozo lace paper, laminated to a flax and linen base sheet, rests a playful, accordion-folded text. This 'pulp painting' (pigmented pulps manipulated during formation of the paper) incorporates bright colors and a heart motif across the ten pages. Gampi and kozo fibers, both natural and with artists' pigments, were used to create this one-of-a-kind art work." and "This piece can be displayed by opening covers to a distance of 14" to 18" and standing the form up on a flat surface. It is, in fact, a tiny paper screen disguised as a book. Depending on the light source, it will reflect and transmit available light."--Slipcase.
subject: Valentine's Day; Miniature books--Specimens

title: Vatican peep
creator: [N/A]
description: Sudbury, Mass. : Kurbel Books; 1 v. : chiefly ill. : 65 mm.; Published with pages configured as a double accordion fold closed at both ends, with two interior cross-pages and the first page designed as a set of double doors to be open, allowing the reader to peep through a window, through hedges, over landscape, to see the dome of St. Peter's cathedral. This peep show is intended to emulate the view of the Aventine Hill, through the keyhole of the doorway to the garden of the Priory of the Knights of Malta, in Rome.
subject: Basilica di San Pietro in Vaticanol; Artists' books--Specimens; Miniature books--Specimens; Rome (Italy) Vatican City

title: Tumbling blocks for Pris and Bruce
creator: Van Vliet, Claire.
contributor: Holden, Audrey. Kaufman, Margaret. Praise basted in.
description: Newark, Vt. : Janus Press; [14] leaves : 56 mm.; Tumbling Blocks is a little cut alphabet created from the offcuts from Praise Basted In, the design of which, left a number of small folios of handmade papers. title: Catch your dreams as they fall
creator: Johnson, Paul, 1943-
description: [Cheshire, England : Paul Johnson]; [10] p. : col. ill. : 52 mm.; A unique artist's book, with original purple line drawings on multi-colored accordion folded paper throughout. title: Der Karneval der Tiere
creator: Vogel, Antje.
contributor: Schneider, Ulla. Adomeit, Ruth E., former owner.
description: Münster : F. Coppenrath; [30] p., [1] p. of leaves : col. ill. : 18 cm.; A carnival of animals, ranging from a lion to a school of fish, are presented by a parrot, who acts as master of ceremonies. title: Butterfly royality
creator: Klinger, Loraine.
contributor: Miniature Book Society former owner. InU
description: [Santa Fe, New Mexico : Loraine Klinger]; 1 v. (unpaged) : col. ill. : 64 mm (70 mm in box).; "The book describes the life-cycle of the Monarch butterfly. The 44 circular pages reinforce the concept of cycles. Each page carries on one side a colored pencil drawing by the author of one stage of the Monarch's developement, and on the other sides facts about the butterfly. The book consists of 44 circular sheets of card-stock, glued together as an accordion fold, enclosed in a cylindrical box." -- MBS 2013 exhibition catalog.
subject: Artists' books--Specimens; Monarch butterfly; Monarch butterfly--Migration; Miniature books--Specimens
